Headline: DPP supporters celebrate victory in Taiwan election
Description: Democratic Progressive Party supporters celebrate at a rally as their opponents concede in the Taiwan election.

Headline: Why the Taiwan election matters to the world
Description: It will redefine Taiwan's relationship with China and have implications for key allies like the US.

Headline: Taiwan elects pro-sovereignty leader, angering Beijing
Description: The move has angered Beijing which reviles Mr Lai and his pro-sovereignty party.

Headline: China says US 'gravely wrong' to congratulate Taiwan leader
Description: Beijing accuses the US of violating its commitment to maintain only unofficial ties with Taiwan.

Headline: China warns Taiwan voters and condemns 'brazen' US
Description: China says the ruling party candidate is a risk to relations, then condemns US "brazen chattering".

Headline: China tells US it will 'never compromise' on Taiwan
Description: The US and China have held their first talks since 2021, days before a crucial election in Taiwan.

Headline: Taiwan just chose a president China loathes. What now?
Description: How William Lai manages Beijing, and how Beijing reacts to him, will determine his presidency.

Headline: The Taiwan party asking voters to choose war or peace
Description: Promising peace with China, the once-dominant KMT faces a difficult balancing act in upcoming polls.

Headline: It's not war Taiwan's young voters worry about - it's jobs
Description: With high home prices and stagnant wages, young voters care more about the economy than Beijing's threats.

Headline: Chinese satellite triggers missile alert in Taiwan
Description: Mobile phone users across Taiwan got an "air raid alert", underlining jitters ahead of pivotal elections.

Headline: The dark horse who has shaken up Taiwan's politics
Description: Ko Wen-je has irrevocably altered Taiwan's political landscape by appealing to Taiwan's young voters.

Headline: Nauru cuts ties with Taiwan in favour of China
Description: Taiwan loses one of its few official allies just days after a presidential election.

Headline: The Taiwan that China wants is vanishing
Description: Taiwan has become what Beijing has always dreaded: a separate place with a separate people.

Headline: The dark rumours trying to destroy Taiwan's trust in US
Description: Beijing is pushing "US scepticism" to drive a wedge between Taiwan and its biggest ally, say analysts.

Headline: Love and longing across the Taiwan Strait: The view from China
Description: Beijing has made its position clear on Taiwan, but what do the country's citizens want?

Headline: How popcorn chicken and bento showcase Taiwan's thorny politics
Description: Unique flavour combinations and profiles represent how Taiwan's unique identity is starting to take shape.

Headline: Xi vows 'reunification' ahead of Taiwan polls
Description: The Chinese leader's New Year's Eve message comes just weeks ahead of Taiwan's crucial general election.

Headline: The three men vying to be Taiwan's next president
Description: The race to succeed the outgoing Tsai Ing-wen comes at a low point in US-China relations.

Headline: The worshippers caught between China and Taiwan
Description: Many Taiwanese follow religions with deep ties to China, which delights Beijing but worries Taipei.

Headline: China denies pressuring Taiwan rock stars
Description: Reports allege Beijing asked Mayday to make pro-China comments and threatened the band when they refused.

Headline: China is ramping up the pressure for Taiwan's election
Description: Beijing is using aggression and propaganda to sway what could be a pivotal race for cross-strait ties.

Headline: China sanctions US defence firms over Taiwan sales
Description: Taiwan is preparing to hold presidential and parliamentary elections on 13 January.

Headline: Taiwan's opposition drama ends with no deal
Description: Despite a week-long attempt, there will be no united opposition ticket in the presidential election.

Headline: China's 'communist spies' in the dock in Taiwan
Description: At least 16 people have been accused of spying on behalf of China in the past year.
